subject: Re: JUnit in Net Beans
msgSnippet: ... Hi Jim You are right. I have added junit.jar in Source Package  Project Properties  Libraries  Compile  Compile- time libraries  Add JAR/Folder It
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, James Dunn <james_h_dunn@y...> wrote:
Hi Jim

You are right. I have added junit.jar in
Source Package > Project Properties > Libraries > Compile > Compile-
time libraries > Add JAR/Folder

It worked now.

Thanks.



> You need the junit.jar in your classpath. Not sure
> how you do that in NetBeans, but there is probably a
> project properties dialog window or something where
> you can tell it which directories and jar files should
> be in your project path.
>
> Good luck.
>
> Jim
>
> --- nayoo1979 <nayoo1979@g...> wrote:
>
> > Hi
> >
> > I am a complete newbie in JUnit and today is my
> > first day learning
> > it. Please bear with me if my question is too dumb.
> >
> > I am using Net Beans IDE 4.1. From that, I am trying
> > to build codes
> > from
> >
> http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/testinfected/testing.htm
> >
> > The problem is that NetBeans does not understand
> > TestCase in
> >
> > public class MoneyTest extends
> > TestCase {
> >
> > so I added
> >
> > import junit.framework.*;
> >
> > Still, it is giving me error as below:
> >
> >
> D:\MyJava\CurrencyTestJunit\src\currencytestjunit\MoneyTest.java:13:
> >
> > package junit.framework does not exist
> > import junit.framework.*;
> >
> D:\MyJava\CurrencyTestJunit\src\currencytestjunit\MoneyTest.java:24:
> >
> > cannot resolve symbol
> > symbol : class TestCase
> > location: class currencytestjunit.MoneyTest
> > public class MoneyTest extends TestCase{
> >
> >
> > Why can't I import junit from NetBean?
> > I am also quite new in Java and beginner level.
> > Please help me if you
> > know the answer.
> >
> > Thank you.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
